intro: Symphytum sylvaticum subsp. sepulcrale, commonly known as the woodland comfrey, is a perennial herb native to Europe. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and tall spikes of violet-blue flowers. The plant is often found in woodland edges and moist soils, thriving in partial to full shade. It has a long history of use in traditional herbal medicine for its healing properties. Botanically, it belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its mucilaginous roots.
